quantityRules.description: Bearded dragons are solitary and territorial. House individually only - minimum 75 gallons (48Ã—24Ã—24 inches).

lifespan: 10-15 years in captivity, 20-25 possible with excellent care
temperament: Very friendly and interactive, enjoys handling and attention
setupTips: Provide basking platform under heat lamp for thermoregulation
Include branches and rocks for climbing enrichment
Full-spectrum lighting is essential for health, such as ~6500k daylight bulbs
notes: Native to arid regions of Australia
Popular pet lizard known for docile temperament
Diurnal and highly active during the day
Omnivorous - requires both insects and vegetables
Social and can be handleable with proper taming

warnings.message: UVB lighting is essential - use tube-style UVB 12.0/10.0 bulbs, not compact coils
Avoid housing multiple bearded dragons together - they are territorial and may fight

feedingRequirements: Insects: crickets, dubia roaches, discus roaches, black soldier fly larvae, mealworms, hornworms, silkworms are all good options
Vegetables: collard greens, cactus pads, spring mix, arugula, kale, bok choy, carrot greens, spinach, dandelion greens, squash, bell peppers, sweet potato, zucchini
Fruits (treats only): blueberries, strawberries, mango, papaya
Supplements: calcium powder and multivitamin powder. Follow label directions
feedingSchedule: Hatchlings (0-6 months): Insects 2x daily, daily vegetables
Juveniles (6-12 months): Insects 1x daily, daily vegetables
Adults (1 year+): Insects 2-3x weekly, daily vegetables
waterNotes: Provide shallow water dish for drinking and soaking
Some beardies prefer to drink from droplets - mist occasionally
Bathing / Soaking is generally not required but can aid hydration
mistingNotes: Light misting cool side 1-2x weekly can aid hydration
Ensure proper ventilation to prevent humidity buildup
